title: 315 entries in Webster’s 1996 dictionary were misspelled.
Flies jump backwards during takeoff.
Dreamt is the only English word that ends in the letters
There are more than 10 million bricks in the Empire State Building.
On average people fear spiders more than they do death.
Denver, Colorado lays claim to the invention of the cheeseburger.
Fur seals get miserably sick when they're carried aboard ships.
Americans on average eat 18 acres of pizza every day.
Peter Falk, who played 'Columbo,' has a glass eye.
A dime has 118 ridges around the edge. A quarter has 119.
Czechs are the biggest consumers of beer per male in the world.
Canadian researchers have found that Einstein's brain was 15% wider than normal.
Sweden has the least number of murders annually.
There are over 58 million dogs in the US
A 'quidnunc' is a person who is eager to know the latest news and gossip.
Of all the words in the English language, the word 'set' has the most definitions!
A man will ejaculate approximately 18 quarts of semen in his lifetime.
Georgia's state motto is 'Wisdom, Justice and Moderation.'
The national anthem of Greece has 158 verses.
In Texas, it is illegal to put graffiti on someone else's cow.
Angel Falls in Venezuela is the world's highest waterfall, at 3,212 feet (979 m).
John Wilkes Booth’s brother once saved the life of Abraham Lincoln’s son.
Rats and horses can’t vomit.
All totalled, the sunlight that strikes Earth at any given moment weighs as much as an ocean liner.
A rhinoceros horn is made of compacted hair.
Your heart beats over 100,000 times a day!
According to Douglas Adams, a Salween is the faint taste of dishwashing liquid in a cup of fresh tea.
In most advertisements, including newspapers, the time displayed on a watch is 10:10.
The average lead pencil will draw a line 35 miles long or write approximately 50,000 English words.
If you toss a penny 10,000 times it will not be heads 5000 times but more like 4950. The head picture weighs more, so it ends up on the bottom.
Bats always turn left when exiting a cave.
Paraskevidekatriaphobia means fear of Friday the 13th, which occurs one to three times a year.
A group of toads is called a knot.
In the Durango desert, in Mexico, there's a creepy spot called the Zone of Silence. You can't pick up clear TV or radio signals. And locals say fireballs sometimes appear in the sky.
Cockroaches favorite food is the glue on the back of stamps.
Months that begin on a Sunday will always have a 'Friday the 13th.'
In Paris, the McDonalds big 'M' is the only one in the world that is white, rather than yellow, it was thought that yellow was too tacky.
Ramses brand condom is named after the great pharaoh Ramses II who fathered over 160 children.
Donkeys kill more people than plane crashes.
Some moths never eat anything as adults because they don't have mouths. They must live on the energy they stored as caterpillars.
If one places a tiny amount of liquor on a scorpion, it will instantly go mad and sting itself to death.
The state of Maryland has no natural Lakes.
Antarctica is the only continent that does not have land areas below sea level.
Chevrolet tried marketing a Chevrolet Nova in Spanish speaking countries - it didn't sell well because NOVA means 'doesn't go' in Spanish.
Because of a large orbital eccentricity, Pluto was closer to the sun than Neptune between January 1979 and March 1999.
If you feed a seagull Alka-Seltzer, its stomach will explode.
When sharks take a bite, their eyes roll back and their teeth jut out.
Your stomach needs to produce a new layer of mucus every two weeks or it would digest itself.
A pig always sleeps on its right side.
There is a hotel in Sweden built entirely out of ice; it is rebuilt every year.
India has a Bill of Rights for cows.
In 1386, a pig in France was executed by public hanging for the murder of a child
A device invented as a primitive steam engine by the Greek engineer Hero, about the time of the birth of Christ, is used today as a rotating lawn sprinkler.
A skunk's smell can be detected by a human a mile away.
An Olympic gold medal must contain 92.5 percent silver

Ever wonder where the phrase two bits came from? Some coins used in the American colonies before the Revolutionary War were Spanish dollars, which could be cut into pieces, or bits. Since two pieces equaled one-fourth dollar, the expression two bits came into being as a name for 25 cents.
People photocopying their buttocks are the cause of 23% of all photocopier faults worldwide.
The original name for butterfly was flutterby.
Eagles can live in captivity for up to 46 years.
Earthworms have 5 hearts.
In England, the Speaker of the House is not allowed to speak.
Many insects can carry 50 times their own body weight. This would be like an adult person lifting two heavy cars full of people.
In 1990, Engineers digging a railway tunnel under the English Channel broke through the last dividing rock and joined Britain to mainland Europe for the first time since the Ice Age.
Degringolade means to fall and disintegrate.
Cats have over 100 vocal sounds; dogs only have 10.
Humphrey Bogart NEVER said 'Play it again, Sam' in Casablanca
A large flawless emerald is worth more than a similarly large flawless diamond.
The rhinoceros beetle is the strongest animal and is capable of lifting 850 times its own weight.
The people of France eat more cheese than any other country in the world.
Male bats have the highest rate of homosexuality of any mammal.
In the Scottish Hebrides, an island is defined as being an island only if it is big enough to sustain 1 sheep.
In Italy, it is illegal to make coffins out of anything except nutshells or wood.
It is impossible to drown and not die. Technically the term 'drowning' refers to the process of taking water into the lungs, not to death caused by that process.
Experts at Intel say that micropr ocessor speed will double every 18 months for at least 10 years.
Hara kiri is an impolite way of saying the Japanese word seppuku which means, literally, belly splitting.
Our eyes are always the same size from birth but our nose and ears never stop growing.
Your stomach produces a new layer of mucus every two weeks so that it doesn’t digest itself.
Maine is the only state that has borders with only one other state.
The pancreas produces Insulin.
Owls are the only birds that can see the color blue.
In Utah, it is illegal to swear in front of a dead person.
Butterflies range in size from a tiny 1/8 inch to a huge almost 12 inches.
Human thighbones are stronger than concrete.
28% of Africa is classified as wilderness. In North America, its 38%.
Isaac Asimov is the only author to have a book in every Dewey-decimal category.

For much of the way, the Lewis and Clark expedition was led by a woman, Sacagawea, a Shoshone Indian. That's where that saying came from... Behind every successful man, there is a woman with a road map.
Venus observa is the technical term for the 'missionary position.'
2,000 pounds of space dust and other space debris fall on the Earth everyday.

A downburst is a downward blowing wind that sometimes comes blasting out of a thunderstorm. The damage looks like tornado damage, since the wind can be as strong as an F2 tornado, but debris is blown straight away from a point on the ground. It's not lifted into the air and transported downwind.
Butterflies taste with their hind feet.
A chameleon's tongue is twice the length of its body.
The highest point in Pennsylvania is lower than the lowest point in Colorado.
A standard grave is 7'8 x 3'2 x 6.
When young, black sea basses are mostly female, but at the age of 5 years many switch sexes to male.
There are 293 ways to make change for a dollar.
About seven million cars are junked each year in the U.S.
The first McDonald's restaurant in Canada was in Richmond, British Columbia.
Each year there is one ton of cement poured for each man woman and child in the world.
An enneahedron is solid with nine faces.
